subject: Re: [junit] Re: Reporting results when running JUnit tests from Java application
msgSnippet: David, I think we re hung up on the difference between: 1) junit.framework.TestListener.  This refers to Test instances, and you shouldn t be using it. 2)
messageBody:
David,

I think we're hung up on the difference between:

1) junit.framework.TestListener. This refers to Test instances, and
you shouldn't be using it.
2) org.junit.runner.notification.RunListener. This refers to
Descriptions, and you should be using it.

Does this help?

David Saff

On Sun, Nov 28, 2010 at 6:01 PM, David <davids@...> wrote:
> Many methods of RunListener refer to a junit.framework.Test item. In my situation thanks to your advice I am able to call my testcases from a separate Java application. I had to remove the 'extend TestCase' statement from my class definition to achieve that. As a result I cannot access/specify a Test item to pass to my RunListener.
> A Test item could have provided a lot of information that I would like to include in my results reporting.
>
> David
>
